Utterance: <sync>
Hi there! It’s nice to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hi Ellie! I’ve been okay, but I’ve had some ups and downs.
It’s good to see you again. Last time, we talked about incorporating mindfulness into your routine and exploring freelance writing. How has that been going?
I’ve tried mindfulness a few times, and it does help. I’ve also started looking into freelance writing gigs.
That’s fantastic! Have you found any opportunities that interest you?
I found a couple of sites where I can pitch ideas, but I haven’t submitted anything yet.
That’s a great start! What’s holding you back from submitting?
I guess I’m just afraid of rejection.
That’s a common fear, especially in creative fields. What if we reframe that fear? Instead of thinking of it as rejection, consider it as a learning opportunity.
That’s a good perspective. I’ll try to keep that in mind.
Excellent! Remember, every submission is a step forward, even if it doesn’t lead to immediate success.
I’ll work on that mindset.
Great! How have your feelings of anxiety been since we last spoke?
They’ve been fluctuating. I still worry about bills, but the writing has helped distract me.
It’s good to have a productive outlet. Have you found any specific strategies that help you manage those anxious thoughts?
I’ve been journaling a bit. It helps me sort through my feelings.
That’s wonderful! Journaling can be a powerful tool for processing emotions. What have you been writing about?
Mostly about my worries and the things I’m grateful for.
That’s a healthy balance. Focusing on gratitude can shift your perspective.
It really does. I feel more positive when I write about good things.
I’m glad to hear that! Let’s talk about your acting pursuits. Have you had any new gigs or auditions?
I had an audition last week, but I’m still waiting to hear back.
How did the audition feel for you?
It felt good, actually. I was nervous, but I think I did my best.
That’s a great attitude! Regardless of the outcome, you should be proud of putting yourself out there.
Thanks, Ellie. It’s nice to hear that.
You’re welcome! It’s important to recognize your efforts. How has your relationship with your wife been since we last talked?
We’ve been communicating better. I think we’re both trying to understand each other more.
That’s wonderful progress! Have you had any specific conversations that stood out?
We talked about our financial situation and how we can tackle it together.
That’s a healthy approach. Teamwork can really strengthen your relationship.
Yeah, it feels good to be on the same page.
That’s great! What are some things you both are doing to support each other?
We’re trying to budget together and discuss our goals.
That’s a fantastic strategy. It sounds like you’re both committed to improving your situation.
We are. It’s nice to have that support.
Support is crucial. How have you been feeling about your daughter’s upcoming graduation?
I’m proud of her! It’s a big milestone, and I’m excited for her future.
That’s wonderful! Have you thought about how you’ll celebrate her achievement?
We’re planning a small family gathering.
That sounds lovely! Celebrating those moments is so important.
Yes, it is. I want her to know how proud we are.
She’ll appreciate that. Is there anything else on your mind that you’d like to discuss today?
I think we’ve covered everything. I feel more optimistic.
I’m glad to hear that! For our next session, let’s continue to focus on your writing and any new developments in your acting career.
Sounds good! I’ll keep working on my goals.
I look forward to hearing about your progress. Thank you for sharing today!
Thank you, Ellie. I appreciate your support.
You’re very welcome! Take care, and I’ll see you next time.
Bye!
